intro: Czerniaevia rupestris, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged alternately along the stems. Czerniaevia rupestris is adapted to harsh environments and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover in horticulture.
